intro: Streptanthus morrisonii subsp. elatus, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and open habitats, such as meadows and slopes. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces numerous small, round seeds. It is a perennial species that thrives in cool, dry climates.
